rooms.description: All around you is the bleak whiteness of the snow covered plateau.  The plateau continues in all directions.  A set of fresh tracks can be seen in the snow, apparently heading north.  They appear human only much larger in size...

rooms.name: Frost Valley Plateau
rooms.description: A fierce wind whips across the flat terrain of the plateau freezing you to the bone.  There is nowhere to seek shelter from the elements.  The plateau stretches out before you in all directions.  Partially covered tracks through the snow indicate that someone or something has recently traveled here.

rooms.name: Frost Valley Plateau
rooms.description: The vast expanse of the plateau stretches out in all directions around you. Everywhere is flat, snow covered terrain.  You notice that there are quite a few tracks through the snow here leading off in all directions.  Some appear human, some are definitely not human!

rooms.name: Edge of Frost Valley Plateau
rooms.description: The vast expanse of the plateau stretches out to the north, east, and west, while to the south there is nothing but air!  A path carefully winds it's way down to the valley floor below.  A cold wind wind blows fiercely over the flat expanse of the plateau.

rooms.name: Frost Valley
rooms.description: To the north the huge plateau that dominates the northeastern part of the valley looms before you.  A narrow trail leads up to the plateau.  The snow covered valley continues on all other sides.

rooms.name: Frost Valley
rooms.description: Tall mountains surround you to the south and west.  To the north and east the valley continues.  A small sign stands near a trail that heads up the mountainside to the south.

rooms.name: Frost Valley Plateau
rooms.description: You are standing along the mountain range that closes in the northwestern section of Frost Valley.  A huge cliff looms over you to the north and west barring any possible travel.  The valley continues to the east and south.

rooms.name: Frost Valley Plateau
rooms.description: You are standing near the northwestern mountain range that encloses Frost Valley.  The plateau stretches off in all directions around you.  A cold wind whips across the valley and you wish you could find shelter from the harsh elements.

rooms.name: Frost Valley Plateau
rooms.description: It is very easy to be come disoriented as the plateau stretches out before you.  A cold wind whips across the valley from the east as you trudge through the knee-deep snow.  Off in the distance you hear the howl of some arctic creature.

rooms.name: Edge of Frost Valley Plateau
rooms.description: You are standing on the edge of the great plateau that stretches out to the north, west and east.  To the south is nothing but air.  A narrow trail carefully winds it way down to the valley floor below.

rooms.name: Frost Valley
rooms.description: The mountain range blocks passage to the south and west.  To the north is the huge plateau of Frost Valley.  A pathway leads up to the plateau while to the east the snow covered valley continues.

rooms.name: Frost Valley Plateau
rooms.description: The mountains that cradle Frost Valley block your passage to the west and north.  A small river of ice cold water flows in from the south and disappears down a small hole in the plateau floor near the base of the mountain to the north.  The plateau continues to the east and south.

rooms.name: Frost Valley Plateau
rooms.description: An ice cold river runs across the plateau from the west and leaves north. The plateau stretches out in all directions around you and you can see a cloud of mists that envelopes this area apparently coming from the west.

rooms.name: Frost Valley Plateau
rooms.description: The large mountain range that cradles Frost Valley blocks your passage to the south.  The plateau continues to the north, east, and west.  A blanket of mist covers the plateau here and seems to continue off to the east.  For a brief second you think you see something huge moving through the mist.

rooms.name: Frost Valley Plateau
rooms.description: A small ice cold river runs through the snow covered plateau.  It comes from a narrow gorge to the west and runs off to the east.  A dense mist clings to the plateau here making it difficult to see.  The plateau continues to the south and east.

rooms.name: Frost Valley Plateau
rooms.description: You are standing at the western most edge of Frost Valley.  The mountain range that encloses Frost Valley bars travel to the south and west.  A huge cave, over 15 feet tall, opens up into the mountain to the south.  The mist is especially thick here.

rooms.name: Wide Passageway
rooms.description: This passageway that heads deep into the mountain is very wide with the ceiling over 25 feet above.  The walls and floor are smooth as if this passageway sees continual use.

rooms.name: Frost Giant Lair
rooms.description: You have entered into the lair of the Frost Giants.  A monstrously huge cavern open up before you.  A roaring fire to the west lights the cavern and keeps it warm.  You can only wonder if the inhabitants of this cavern will be happy to see you here ...  Invading their home.

rooms.name: Frost Giant Lair
rooms.description: This area of the cavern is used by the Frost Giants for dinning.  A huge roughly chiselled stone table stands in the middle of this section.  A large wooden shelf holds various jars, pots, and other cooking utensils.  The cavern continues to the north and west.

rooms.name: Frost Giant Lair
rooms.description: A large fire pit dominates this section of the cavern.  A circle of rocks defines the border of the fire pit while a huge fire blazes away giving off warmth and light.  The cavern continues to the south and east.

rooms.name: Frost Giant Lair
rooms.description: Large patches of straw and course blankets are strewn about the floor of this section of the cavern.  Obviously this is the area were the Frost Giants sleep.  The cavern continues to the north and east.

rooms.name: Gorge
rooms.description: High steep walls to the south and west enclose this narrow gorge.  A small ice cold river runs down the gorge from the north and exists out onto the plateau to the east.  The sound of falling water can be heard from the north. A mist is very thick here and you can see no more than a few feet in front of you.

rooms.name: Waterfall (Gorge)
rooms.description: A huge waterfall to the north crashes over the steep cliffs that enclose this narrow valley.  The sound is deafening and a great cloud of mist and water vapor is created by the falling water.  The mist seems to travel off to the south along the gorge.  A river of ice cold water is formed by the falling water and runs south.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Black Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: It would appear that something or someone just ripped its way, slowly, through the mountain.  The tunnel is jagged and uneven and is definitely not naturally made.  The ice, through which this tunnel has been made, has been turned totally black in color by some strange force.  The wisest course of action would be to turn and run from the place; but, for those who do not heed such counsel, the tunnel continues to the east.

rooms.name: Black Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel continues to travel roughly east and west from here.  For a moment you get the feeling that you are walking backwards, but suddenly everything feels normal again.  You begin to have doubts about the intelligence of continuing down this tunnel of blackness.

rooms.name: Turn in Black Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel ripped through the ice curves here leading both to the north and west from here.  A strange, almost imperceptible, noise seems to be coming from further down the tunnel to the north.  You can't quite make out the sound...

rooms.name: Another Turn in Black Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel through the blackened ice curves again here leading off to the south and east.  Again, you get the feeling of walking backwards and for a moment you can't remember what day it is.  But the strange feeling quickly passes.  Maybe coming down this tunnel was not such a wise choice.

rooms.name: Black Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel through the blackened ice continues to the east and west.  To the east the tunnel open up into a large cavern in the ice.  You can see that the ice in the cavern has been blackened also.  The noise is definitely coming from within the cavern.  It is a low 'Thump Thump' repeated over and over, pausing only for a second between beats...

rooms.name: Black Ice Cavern
rooms.description: This huge cavern is made of blackened ice.  Jagged sections of the wall hang down almost to the floor.  The jagged uneven floor rises up in places to meet the stalactites as if trying to form some unholy union.  The low sound of a beating heart seems to be coming from the east.  The cavern continues to the south and east.

rooms.name: Black Ice Cavern
rooms.description: This huge cavern is made of blackened ice.  Jagged sections of the wall hang down almost to the floor.  The jagged uneven floor rises up in places to meet the stalactites as if trying to form some unholy union.  The low sound of a beating heart seems to echo through the area.  The cavern continues to the south and west.

rooms.name: Black Ice Cavern
rooms.description: This blackened cavern of ice gives off a feeling of hatred and rage as if the very cavern was alive and pulsating with evil.  An oily black substance is oozing out of the wall to the south.  It gives of a horrid stench that threatens to overpower you.  The cavern continues to the north and east.

rooms.name: Black Ice Cavern
rooms.description: Large chunks of blackened ice litter this section of the cavern.  The sound of the beating heart seems especially loud here as it echoes in from the north. A sense of uneasiness and dread presses down all around you, threatening to engulf you.  You have to fight back the urge to run from this place.

rooms.name: Ice Ledge Trail
rooms.description: A narrow trail chiselled into the mountain of ice before carefully winds it way up the mountainside.  High up on the mountain to the north you can see some sort of structure made of wood and stone.  It is well hidden from the valley floor and you realize that maybe that was the intent of the builders.  The trail continues to the north.

rooms.name: Ice Ledge Trail
rooms.description: This narrow trail has been chiselled into the solid mountain of ice before you.  Travel is slow and dangerous and you wonder who could be crazy chisel a path up the side of a mountain.  The trail continues up and to the south.

rooms.name: Ice Ledge Trail
rooms.description: The narrow trail carved into the side of the mountain leads down and also off to the west.  A fierce wind blows from the south making travel slow and dangerous.

rooms.name: Ice Ledge Trail
rooms.description: The trail winds around a curve in the mountain and heads up.  You can also follow the trail back down the mountain by heading east.  From here you can see far across the valley including the tall tower of the Frost Elves.

rooms.name: Outside Trapper's Lodge
rooms.description: The trail ends outside a lodge made of wood with a stone foundation.  The lodge is situated high on a cliff overlooking Frost Valley.  From here you can see various creatures moving about on the valley floor.  The lodge is to the west while a narrow trail will take you back down to the valley floor.

West.description: An old wooden door reinforced with metal offers entrance to those who possess the key to unlock it.

rooms.name: Trapper's Lodge Entrance
rooms.description: The entrance hall to the trapper's lodge is lined with monuments of the various creatures hunted by the trappers.  The heads of deer, rabbits, even a wooly mammoth decorate the walls.  A door to the east leads outside.  The small entrance hall opens up into a larger hall to the north.

East.description: This old wooden door leads to the outside.  It has bravely held back the elements for untold years.

rooms.name: Trapper's Lodge Hall
rooms.description: This huge hall acts as a dining, meeting, recreating, and work hall.  A huge dining table stands in the middle of the hall while various small tables lining the walls seem to be used as places to skin the animals.  Various pelts hang from the wall and a fireplace along the north wall adds warmth to the lodge. A stairway leads upstairs.

West.description: This stout wooden door leads outside behind the Trapper's Lodge.

rooms.name: Trapper's Sleeping Quarters
rooms.description: Five small bunk beds line the walls of this large room.  A footlocker is positioned at the base of each bed.  A fire burns brightly in a fireplace along the south wall keeping this room warm.  To the west is the larger lodge hall.

rooms.name: Trapper's Lodge Lookout
rooms.description: A small lookout is built atop the lodge from where the trappers can keep a lookout on the valley below.  Off in the distance to the southwest you can see the tower of the Frost Elves.  To the south is a large coniferous forest.  A staircase leads back down into the lodge.

rooms.name: Outside Trapper's Lodge
rooms.description: You are standing behind Trapper's lodge.  A low wall of stones to the north and west act as a boundary of sorts.  To the east a doorway leads back into the warmth of Trapper's Lodge.  To the south is a large pen that is used to house the trapped animals before they are skinned.

East.description: A stout wooden door set into the wall leads back into the warmth of the trapper's lodge.

South.description: A huge door made of metal blocks any entrance into the trapper's pens.  It also keeps any animals in the pens from coming out...

rooms.name: Trapper's Pen
rooms.description: This huge cage made of wood and iron is meant to hold the various animals the trappers catch before they are killed and skinned.  Blood of the previous inhabitants of this cage line the walls and floor.  Decomposing piles of dung litter the floor.  The stench of decay is almost overpowering.

North.description: This huge metal door prevents any of the animals trapped in here from escaping.

rooms.name: Over Frost Valley
rooms.description: You are surrounding in the mists that blanket Frost Valley.  You realize that there is nothing solid under your feet.  To the west is the edge of the Plateau.

rooms.name: Over Frost Valley
rooms.description: You are surrounded by the mist that blankets Frost Valley.  You realize that there is nothing solid under your feet!  To the west and north you can just make out the edge of the plateau.

rooms.name: Over Frost Valley
rooms.description: You are surrounded by the mist that blanket Frost Valley.  You realize that there is nothing solid under your feet.  To the west you can just make out the edge of the plateau.

rooms.name: Over Frost Valley
rooms.description: You are surrounded by the mist that blankets Frost Valley.  You realize that there is nothing solid under your feet!  To the north you can just make out the edge of the plateau.

rooms.name: Over Frost Valley
rooms.description: You are surrounded by the mist that blankets Frost Valley.  You realize that there is nothing solid under your feet!  To the north you can just make out the edge of the plateau.

rooms.name: Over Frost Valley
rooms.description: You are surrounded in the mist that blankets Frost Valley.  You realize that there is nothing solid under your feet!  To the north you can just make out the edge of the plateau.

rooms.name: Narrow Ledge
rooms.description: This narrow ledge rises steeply as it hugs the cliff face.  Travel is slow and dangerous as you wonder where this trail leads.  The trail continues to the south.

rooms.name: Narrow Ledge Bend
rooms.description: The narrow trails bends here leading both north and east.  Below you is the vast expanse of Frost Valley.  Far off to the east you can see the tower of the Frost Elves.

rooms.name: Narrow Ledge
rooms.description: This narrow ledge carved into the cliff face climbs up and west from here. A light mist surrounds you and you can see that the mist in fact covers all of Frost Valley in a blanket of gray.

rooms.name: Over Frost Valley
rooms.description: You are surrounded by the mist that blankets Frost Valley.  You realize that there is nothing solid under your feet!  To the south you can just make out the ledge of a narrow trail.

rooms.name: Over Frost Valley
rooms.description: You are surrounded by the mist that blankets Frost Valley.  You realize that there is nothing solid under you feet!  To the west and south you can just make out a narrow ledge.

rooms.name: Over Frost Valley
rooms.description: You are surrounded by the mist that covers Frost Valley.  You realize that there is nothing solid under you feet!  To the west you can just make out a narrow ledge.

rooms.name: Outside Ysgarran's Keep
rooms.description: You are standing on the top of the cliff that overlooks the southwestern section of the valley.  You can barely see the valley floor through the mists that blanket the valley.  A low stone wall has been constructed around the edge of the cliff, probably for safety reasons.  To the west a small stone keep seems to keep a watchful eye over Frost Valley.  A small sign in front of the keep contains a greetings to all travelers.

West.description: A stout oaken door with metal bands is set into the thick stone walls of the keep.

extras.text: +-------------------------------------------------------+ |							| |	Greetings Traveler,				| |							| |		Please enjoy the hospitality of the	| |	the Clan Ysgarran.  You may find warmth by	| |	our fire and hot food to aid you on your 	| |	journey.  All are most welcome to our humble	| |	keep.						| |							| |				--Ysgarran		| |							| +-------------------------------------------------------+ |	| |	| |	| |	| |	|

rooms.name: Keep Entrance Hall
rooms.description: This small entrance hall built of large gray stones is decorated with long green banners.  The banners contain the crest of Ysgarran: a double headed eagle.  To the east a stout oaken door keeps out the elements.  To the north the huge dining hall of Ysgarran's keep opens up before you.  Its warmth is very inviting.

East.description: A stout oaken door reinforced with large metal bands keeps out the elements.

rooms.name: Keep's Great Hall
rooms.description: A large roaring fire along the keeps western wall fills this great hall with warmth and life.  A massive banquet table is laid out in the center of the hall.  Two sturdy oaken benches flank both sides of the table.  A narrow staircase built against the north wall leads up to the second floor of the keep.  To the west a doorway leads to the kitchen.  A long banner hangs from the north wall recording the great history of the clan of Ysgarran.

West.description: A simple oaken door leads to the kitchen.

rooms.name: Keep's Kitchen
rooms.description: Before you lies the keep's great kitchen.  Huge pots hang from massive iron pegs over a fire, rabbit stew boiling away in each.  A long table is placed against the north wall and various cooking utensils decorate it.  A small stairway leads down to the cellar below.  A door to the east leads back to the Great Hall.

East.description: A simple oaken door leads to the Great Hall.

rooms.name: Keep's Cellar
rooms.description: This dark damp cellar is lined with crates storing foodstuffs and various other supplies.  You get the impression that with the supplies stored here the keep could withstand a siege for months.

rooms.name: Hallway
rooms.description: You are in a narrow hallway that ends in a simple oaken door.  A stairway against the north wall leads down to the great hall below.  Half spent torches burn in iron sconces.

South.description: This simple oaken door probably leads to a bedroom.

rooms.name: Ysgarran's Bedroom
rooms.description: The bedroom before you is of simple design.  A large bed is placed against one corner of the room and a simple dresser and table line the wall.  A large painting, presumably of the Ysgarran clan, hangs across from the bed.

North.description: This simple oaken door leads back to the hallway.

rooms.name: Keep's Lookout
rooms.description: From this lookout atop the keep you have a commanding view of Frost Valley below you.  Although it is rather difficult to see through the patches of mist there are sufficient clearings in the mists to keep a watchful eye on the valley below.

rooms.name: Over Frost Valley
rooms.description: You can hardly see through the mist that surrounds you on all sides.  You realize that there is nothing solid under your feet!  To the west you can just make out a narrow ledge cut into the mountainside.

rooms.name: Over Frost Valley
rooms.description: You can hardly see through the mists that surround you on all sides.  You realize that there is nothing solid under your feet!  To the west you can just make out the stone wall of a keep, while to the south you can see a narrow trail cut into the mountainside.

rooms.name: Over Frost Valley
rooms.description: The mist that blankets Frost Valley is all around you.  You realize that there is nothing solid under your feet!  To the south you can just make out the stone wall of a keep.

rooms.name: Over Frost Valley
rooms.description: The mist that blankets Frost Valley surrounds you on all sides.  You realize that there is nothing solid under your feet!  To the west you can just make out the stone tower of a keep.

rooms.name: Over Frost Valley
rooms.description: The mists that blanket Frost Valley surround you on all sides.  You realize that there is nothing solid under your feet!  To the south you can just make out the stone tower of a keep.

rooms.name: Over Frost Valley
rooms.description: You realize that there is nothing solid under your feet!  The mists that blanket Frost Valley surround you.  To the west you can see the lookout of the stone keep.

rooms.name: Over Frost Valley
rooms.description: You realize there is nothing solid under your feet!  The mists that cover Frost Valley surround you on all sides.  To the south you can just make out the lookout of the keep.

rooms.name: Buried Under an Avalanche
rooms.description: There's not much air in here, and you can't tell which way is up or down. Not that you will be getting out in a hurry.  Better hope your friends didn't get caught in this too.

rooms.name: Giant Lynx's Lair
rooms.description: You are standing in a large cavern dug underground.  It is relatively warm in here and offers refuge from the elements.  However, this appears to be the home of some giant arctic creature and it is doubtful it will welcome visitors to its lair.

rooms.name: Portal to the Plane of Garl'lixxil
rooms.description: As you step through the portal you feel as if your entire body is being ripped VIOLENTLY out of the world you know.  You can only wonder where this portal leads however there is no going back.  You have committed yourself and now you must face whatever horrors lie on the other side...

rooms.name: Tower Courtyard
rooms.description: There is a huge courtyard here, from which the snow has been painstakingly shoveled to the walls.  A large tower to the north dominates the courtyard. The tower has four floors, each of which seems to have several windows facing the courtyard.  Large wooden doors in the wall to the north lead into the tower, and a huge metal gate in the east wall leads out of the courtyard.

North.description: A large, intricately carved wooden door.

East.description: A huge metal gate is set into the wall that surrounds this courtyard.  Beyond the gate are the shores of Frost Valley lake.

rooms.name: Tower Foyer
rooms.description: This foyer is circular in shape and quite wide in diameter, stretching the length of a large trireme.  Extravagent sculpted pillars bridge the floor and a circular stone landing that wraps around the chamber above.  Each carving depicts a different field of knowledge, and some are quite astonishing, as if the sculptor wanted his audience to be awed by the importance of this tower and its contents.  A majestic marble staircase spirals upwards in the center of the hall, meeting the landing above.  Beams of light stream down at the center of the stair, illuminating the entire foyer with its radiance.  A large arch in the east wall opens up into a beautiful vaulted hall, and two large wooden doors to the south lead out to the courtyard.

South.description: A large, intricately carved wooden door.

rooms.name: The First Landing
rooms.description: Circularly shaped, this landing wraps around the interior of main portion of the tower.  A golden railing divides the landing, only a few paces across, from the open air at the center of the tower.  Spiraling through the center of the citadel, a flawless marble stair pauses briefly at the landing on its journey up and down the tower.  The spiral staircase continues downward to the tower foyer and farther upward to another landing.  Vibrant beams of light shine down at the center of the staircase from somewhere high above, reflecting off its polished surface to light this entire landing.  A large entryway in the east wall leads to a large library.

rooms.name: The Hall of Brilliance
rooms.description: Built from strong, beautiful marble, this ballroom has high majestic ceilings with complex bejeweled vaults.  Tall glass windows rise from waist level to the beginning of the curving ceiling, trimmed with long velvety blue drapery.  The curtains are opened, allowing in the vibrant sunlight during the day and the pristine starlight at night.  At the eastern end of the hall, a slightly raised platform serves as a stage for announcements and music.  An immense arched entryway in the west wall opens up to the tower's foyer.

rooms.name: The Second Landing
rooms.description: Wrapping around the inside of the main tower, this stone landing has a silver railing and is slightly narrower than the landing below.  Open air fills the center of the chamber, a long fall down to the tower foyer below.  A splendid spiral staircase rises through the center of the tower, stopping briefly at this landing on its journey from the foyer to the apex.  Bright beams of light are channeled from somewhere above, illuminating the landing on their way down to the base of the tower.  Another landing can be seen below this one, and pillars stationed periodically around the landing support another one above.  An arch in the east wall opens to a royally decorated room.

rooms.name: The Great Library
rooms.description: Books of all sizes and languages dominate this spacious room.  Tall shelves stand against all four walls, and out into the room forming small aisles. Near the south wall, a series of heavy pine desks take advantage of the light that streams through the large windows on that side of the library.  Several lacquered wooden pillars are spread through the room, decorated by complex inscriptions seemingly designed to help a reader locate a book.  There are small icons depicting medicine, law, and many other disciplines at the tops of the bookshelves.  A large open door to the west presents access to the tower landings.

extras.text: The carvings are in an elaborate elven script, far too enigmatic for you to decipher.

rooms.name: The Third Landing
rooms.description: The tower grows narrow here, with the landing around the edge barely an armspan across.  A spiral staircase leads downwards here, centered in the open air shaft of the tower.  Dozens of small mirrored shafts near the tip of the tower reflect light in and down the center of the stair shaft, illuminating the entire tower.  Some lower windows about waist level around the landing present a majestic view of the snowy valley and lake around, providing clear and early warning of any territorial intrusion.  Complex elven runes cover the walls, telling the history of the Frost Elves and their collected knowledge.  The marble stair leads down to the second landing.

rooms.name: A Reading Room
rooms.description: Plush white sofas are spread about the room, surrounded by dark wooden endtables.  A wooden bar runs along the eastern edge of the room, lined with bottles and packages.  Tall bay windows stretch the height of the walls to the north and south, presenting a beautiful view of the frigid landscape outside. Attractive creeping ivy grows up the sides of the windows, forming natural self-sustained curtains.  Some kind of magical force maintains a pleasant temperature in the room and indeed the entire tower, sealing the frost and chill outside.  A line of round wooden tables runs down the center of the room, each encircled by several kingly chairs.  An arch opens up to the tower landings to the west.

rooms.name: Frost Elf Island
rooms.description: The dark waters of Frost Valley lake lap against the shores of this small island to the south and east.  To the north, the huge white tower of the Frost Elves rises up before you, becoming lost in the mists that cover the lake.  To the west, a huge wall with a metal gate encloses a courtyard.

West.description: A huge metal gate is set into the thick stone wall that surrounds the courtyard.  It is known that the Frost Elves only allow those of pure heart into their domain.

extras.text: This room is part of the "past elf tower."  It should have an enter trigger that prevents players from entering.  However, it will allow mobs to enter from the west, to create the illusion of more beyond the tower.  Those mobs will not be able to go east or south though, because there should be enter triggers on those rooms preventing past-elf mobs from entering.
